title: Intoduction to ukhsadatR
text: ukhsadatR package provides easy access UK Health Security Agency (UKHSA) data via API.

title: Intoduction to ukhsadatR
text: demonstrates retrieve daily reported COVID-19 cases national level England:
code: library(ukhsadatR)  get_data(   theme = "infectious_disease",   sub_theme = "respiratory",   topic = "COVID-19",   geography_type = "Nation",   geography = "England",   metric = "COVID-19_cases_casesByDay" ) |>   head() #>                theme   sub_theme    topic geography_type geography #> 1 infectious_disease respiratory COVID-19         Nation   England #> 2 infectious_disease respiratory COVID-19         Nation   England #> 3 infectious_disease respiratory COVID-19         Nation   England #> 4 infectious_disease respiratory COVID-19         Nation   England #> 5 infectious_disease respiratory COVID-19         Nation   England #> 6 infectious_disease respiratory COVID-19         Nation   England #>   geography_code                    metric metric_group stratum sex age year #> 1      E92000001 COVID-19_cases_casesByDay        cases default all all 2020 #> 2      E92000001 COVID-19_cases_casesByDay        cases default all all 2020 #> 3      E92000001 COVID-19_cases_casesByDay        cases default all all 2020 #> 4      E92000001 COVID-19_cases_casesByDay        cases default all all 2020 #> 5      E92000001 COVID-19_cases_casesByDay        cases default all all 2020 #> 6      E92000001 COVID-19_cases_casesByDay        cases default all all 2020 #>   month epiweek       date metric_value in_reporting_delay_period #> 1     1       5 2020-01-30            1                     FALSE #> 2     1       5 2020-01-31            0                     FALSE #> 3     2       5 2020-02-01            0                     FALSE #> 4     2       5 2020-02-02            1                     FALSE #> 5     2       6 2020-02-03           18                     FALSE #> 6     2       6 2020-02-04            0                     FALSE

what: R Interface to Access UKHSA Dashboard Data
title: R Interface to Access UKHSA Dashboard Data
text: wrapper UKHSA Data Dashboard API, data can easily imported R. detailed documentation UKHSA data dashboard API available . package based upon ukcovid19 package previously published Public Health England substantially rewritten extended.

title: R Interface to Access UKHSA Dashboard Data
text: install latest release version CRAN: install latest development version:

title: R Interface to Access UKHSA Dashboard Data
text: API wrapper bypass pagination process always download full dataset specified metric, however, single metric can downloaded time.

title: R Interface to Access UKHSA Dashboard Data
text: obtain daily reported cases COVID-19, use following:
code: get_data(   theme = "infectious_disease",   sub_theme = "respiratory",   topic = "COVID-19",   geography_type = "Nation",   geography = "England",   metric = "COVID-19_cases_casesByDay" )

title: Get Data — get_data
text: Iteratively runs get_paginated_data download results combine data.frame.

title: Get Data — get_data
code: get_data(   theme = NULL,   sub_theme = NULL,   topic = NULL,   geography_type = NULL,   geography = NULL,   metric = NULL )

title: Get Data — get_data
text: theme largest overall topical subgroup data. example infectious_disease. sub_theme topical subgroup associated parent theme. example respiratory. topic categorical subgroup associated selected theme sub_theme. example, COVID-19. geography_type overarching area type intended geography. example Nation. geography selected area geography_type. example England. metric type data selected. example COVID-19_testing_PCRcountByDay.

title: Get Data — get_data
text: information UKHSA dashboard API please visit API documentation.
code: If any input argument is left NULL or invalid, a list                    of possible values for that parameter is returned.

title: Get Data — get_data
code: get_data(   theme = "infectious_disease",   sub_theme = "respiratory",   topic = "COVID-19",   geography_type = "Nation",   geography = "England",   metric = "COVID-19_cases_casesByDay" ) |>   head() #>                theme   sub_theme    topic geography_type geography #> 1 infectious_disease respiratory COVID-19         Nation   England #> 2 infectious_disease respiratory COVID-19         Nation   England #> 3 infectious_disease respiratory COVID-19         Nation   England #> 4 infectious_disease respiratory COVID-19         Nation   England #> 5 infectious_disease respiratory COVID-19         Nation   England #> 6 infectious_disease respiratory COVID-19         Nation   England #>   geography_code                    metric metric_group stratum sex age year #> 1      E92000001 COVID-19_cases_casesByDay        cases default all all 2020 #> 2      E92000001 COVID-19_cases_casesByDay        cases default all all 2020 #> 3      E92000001 COVID-19_cases_casesByDay        cases default all all 2020 #> 4      E92000001 COVID-19_cases_casesByDay        cases default all all 2020 #> 5      E92000001 COVID-19_cases_casesByDay        cases default all all 2020 #> 6      E92000001 COVID-19_cases_casesByDay        cases default all all 2020 #>   month epiweek       date metric_value in_reporting_delay_period #> 1     1       5 2020-01-30            1                     FALSE #> 2     1       5 2020-01-31            0                     FALSE #> 3     2       5 2020-02-01            0                     FALSE #> 4     2       5 2020-02-02            1                     FALSE #> 5     2       6 2020-02-03           18                     FALSE #> 6     2       6 2020-02-04            0                     FALSE

title: Get Paginated Data — get_paginated_data
text: Generates API query URL retrieves paginated data.

title: Get Paginated Data — get_paginated_data
code: get_paginated_data(   theme = NULL,   sub_theme = NULL,   topic = NULL,   geography_type = NULL,   geography = NULL,   metric = NULL,   page_number = 1,   page_size = 365 )

title: Get Paginated Data — get_paginated_data
text: theme largest overall topical subgroup data. example infectious_disease. sub_theme topical subgroup associated parent theme. example respiratory. topic categorical subgroup associated selected theme sub_theme. example, COVID-19. geography_type overarching area type intended geography. example Nation. geography selected area geography_type. example England. metric type data selected. example COVID-19_testing_PCRcountByDay. page_number define page data retrieve page_size define number results returned per page. Maximum supported size 365.

title: Get Paginated Data — get_paginated_data
code: list containing the query structure and results

title: Get Paginated Data — get_paginated_data
code: If any input argument is left NULL or invalid, a list                    of possible values for that parameter is returned.

title: Get Paginated Data — get_paginated_data
code: get_paginated_data(   theme = "infectious_disease",   sub_theme = "respiratory",   topic = "COVID-19",   geography_type = "Nation",   geography = "England",   metric = "COVID-19_cases_casesByDay",   page_number = 2,   page_size = 6 ) #> $count #> [1] 1973 #>  #> $`next` #> [1] "https://api.ukhsa-dashboard.data.gov.uk/themes/infectious_disease/sub_themes/respiratory/topics/COVID-19/geography_types/Nation/geographies/England/metrics/COVID-19_cases_casesByDay?page=3&page_size=6" #>  #> $previous #> [1] "https://api.ukhsa-dashboard.data.gov.uk/themes/infectious_disease/sub_themes/respiratory/topics/COVID-19/geography_types/Nation/geographies/England/metrics/COVID-19_cases_casesByDay?page_size=6" #>  #> $results #>                theme   sub_theme    topic geography_type geography #> 1 infectious_disease respiratory COVID-19         Nation   England #> 2 infectious_disease respiratory COVID-19         Nation   England #> 3 infectious_disease respiratory COVID-19         Nation   England #> 4 infectious_disease respiratory COVID-19         Nation   England #> 5 infectious_disease respiratory COVID-19         Nation   England #> 6 infectious_disease respiratory COVID-19         Nation   England #>   geography_code                    metric metric_group stratum sex age year #> 1      E92000001 COVID-19_cases_casesByDay        cases default all all 2020 #> 2      E92000001 COVID-19_cases_casesByDay        cases default all all 2020 #> 3      E92000001 COVID-19_cases_casesByDay        cases default all all 2020 #> 4      E92000001 COVID-19_cases_casesByDay        cases default all all 2020 #> 5      E92000001 COVID-19_cases_casesByDay        cases default all all 2020 #> 6      E92000001 COVID-19_cases_casesByDay        cases default all all 2020 #>   month epiweek       date metric_value in_reporting_delay_period #> 1     2       6 2020-02-05            1 title: ukhsadatR 0.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2025-06-18 updated errors/warnings fail gracefully messages, given dependancy external API URL.
